resources.string: Be able to steer left and right
Use little hops to get over obstacles
Never have to stop for small stairs
Like gravel, cobble stones or grass
What muscles does inline skating train?
How to train for inline skating in the gym
What to look for when buying inline skates
What to look for when buying protective gear

Forward Stride

 • Start slow and use small steps
 • Keep the center of gravity low
 • Practice to stay on one foot
 • Look forward and not down

T-Stop

 • Start stopping with a low velocity
 • For the begging only use a few rolls at a time
 • Grind the ground for a few seconds then gradually progress
 • To increase pressure properly ensure that the front knee is bent low

Parallel Turn

 • Notice the inside and outside edges of your skates
 • Start with slight turns and then progress into sharper ones
 • Additionally lead with the shoulders and hips into the turn
 • Move the balance into the middle wheels and not the front or back

Slalom: Fish

 • After a parallel turn quickly scissor switch your stance
 • Shift the balance to the opposite side during each stance switch
 • Swing the arms into the opposite direction of the turns for balance
 • Keep the upper body straight

(Not a) jump!

 • Start with small hops
 • Swing the arms up for height
 • Bent the knees when landing to soften the impact
 • Additionally align the shoulders with the hips, knees and front wheels when landing

Backward Stride

 • Rotate and open your upper body to peek over the shoulders 
 • Keep the center of gravity low
 • Start slow and use small steps
 • If you are not comfortable with backward skating, use a wall for support

Crossovers

 • Start with a wide stance
 • Rotate and lead with the upper body first and then…
 • … cross the legs in front of each other
 • Use the inside edges of the skates

Crossovers Backwards

 • Start with a wide stance
 • Rotate and lead with the upper body first and then…
 • … cross the legs in front of each other
 • Use the inside edges of the skates

Jump 180

 • Start with small hops
 • Swing the arms up and sideways for height and easier rotation
 • Bent the knees when landing to soften the impact
 • Additionally align the shoulders with the hips, knees and front wheels when landing

Freestyle: Mohawk Eagle

 • Keep the hips and center of gravity low
 • Start with very slow speed and spread your legs
 • Pointing the toes is easier when hips are low
 • Use the inside edges for the mohawk and the outside edges for the eagle

Speed Skating: Double Push

 • Start the first push with a aerodynamic forward stride (Novice Lesson 1)
 • Now shift the weight to the opposite leg and push with the outer edge first… 
 • … then transfer to the inside edge, while the other leg comes back to the center
 • repeat the cycle by shifting the weight to the other leg • Be sure to have your hips parallel to the ground at all times

Power Slide

 • Start with a low velocity and progress to higher velocities
 • Shift the weight to the front leg and start a very sharp parallel side turn…
 • … with the front leg being fixed perpendicular to the direction of movement
 • Apply moderate pressure to the inside edge of the back leg to grind the ground
 • Be sure to keep the weight on the front leg and not the back leg

Skate down stairs

 • Start with low quantity and flatter stairs
 • Keep the center of gravity very low and shift the balance to the back leg
 • Be sure to not look at the stairs and instead concentrate on where to land
 • Use the arms for balance, where the front arm is pointing towards the landing spot

Skate through uneven ground

 • Start with low quantity, flatter gravel and slow velocity
 • Keep the center of gravity very low and have both legs scissor close to each other
 • Balance the weight on both legs and not just one
 • Be sure to not look at the gravel and instead concentrate on the destination
 • The most difficult part is the first step, so start with a small hop and fight through it

Single leg MASTERY

 • Being able to control well with one foot requires immense balance…
 • … and the video demonstrates multiple exercises for that
 • So this lesson is currently the last and a new skill level will be released in the next product update!
 • Until then, be sure to keep practicing and have fun :)
